name: suffocatingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes you feel very hot, uncomfortable, or unable to breathe: It was suffocatingly hot in the sun: not a breath of wind reached the courtyard. The Met museum in New York doesn't seem to get as suffocatingly crowded as its French counterpart the Louvre.
in a way that does not allow you to act freely or develop: They had an unhealthy and suffocatingly intense relationship. She did not envy Anna her happiness, because she knew she would find her sister's life suffocatingly boring.
More examplesFewer examplesThe silence in the room was suffocatingly heavy.Her fear can be felt in her drawings, which depict nightmarish worlds of suffocatingly black, claustrophobic tunnels.The relentless criticism feels suffocatingly miserable, every single day, but you try not to think about it.My generation is already suffocatingly safety conscious, so we don't need these ridiculous new road safety rules.
